item.title: A Wizard of Earthsea
item.description: This felt like something between prologue and parable, and yet I’m still into it. More Earthsea, here I come.

item.title: The Adventures of Amina al-Sirafi
item.description: A rollicking pirate adventure AND an extensive bibliography for the historical accuracies! Be still my heart! This was brilliant. It would be easier to make a list of the things I didn’t like about it than all the things I loved.

item.title: A Restless Truth
item.description: This was so close to being great. SO CLOSE. But overall, the book felt kind of like the menagerie on board the ship, let loose in all directions, refusing to be corralled.

item.title: A Taste of Honey
item.description: That ending! Talk about an ending that twists everything you thought you read for the previous 159 pages (I dare say, happily so).

item.title: Liberty & Other Stories
item.description: I did not think I could love the [[series/prosperityverse|Prosperityverse]] more, BUT I DO.

item.title: The Tombs of Atuan
item.description: The funny thing is, I sometimes resist reading Ursula K. Le Guin. Because I know I’ll have to stop, and do nothing else, and absorb through my pores, and not read any of the other ten or twelve things I might have read that week, and just camp out in her world as long as I can.

item.title: Three Kings
item.description: Another for my collection of killer opening lines: Ethan Shaw carried two knives, one for lilies, the other for veins.
